title: Conserving our forests today
brief_description: Provides a look at what was considered recent advances in forest conservation in 1960, such as the use of helicopters and plastic hose in fire-fighting, new insecticides and chemicals for the control of disease, aerial seeding and mechanical transplanting. The value of forests for timber, grazing, water, recreation; how forest lands are being protected and renewed for the future.
